Skin Examination.purpose: Assess characteristics of the rash present on the lower legs.

content.content: Red and purple, slightly raised spots on the lower legs and buttocks, non-blanching and mildly tender.

Musculoskeletal Examination.purpose: Evaluate any joint tenderness and range of motion.

findings.content: Mild tenderness in knees and ankles without swelling, redness, or warmth; full range of motion is preserved.

Musculoskeletal Examination.interpretation: Joint tenderness may be associated with underlying vasculitis.

Abdominal Examination.purpose: Assess for any signs of abdominal pain or tenderness.

findings.content: Mild tenderness in the lower abdomen with no guarding or rebound tenderness.

Abdominal Examination.interpretation: Tenderness may suggest possible gastrointestinal involvement.

Vitals Check.purpose: Monitor the patient's basic physiological parameters.

Respiratory Examination.purpose: Assess respiratory function and presence of any abnormalities.
Respiratory Examination.interpretation: No respiratory issues contributing to the current condition.

Ophthalmologic Examination.purpose: Examine the eyes for any signs of systemic disease.

Lymph Node Examination.interpretation: No signs of systemic infection or malignancy.

Oral Examination.purpose: Inspect oral cavity for any lesions or abnormalities.

findings.content: Oral cavity normal with no lesions.

Oral Examination.interpretation: Oral examination does not reveal systemic issues.

Complete Blood Count (CBC).purpose: Evaluate blood cell counts and identify any anomalies.
Complete Blood Count (CBC).interpretation: Shows mild elevation in WBC indicative of inflammation.

Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR).purpose: Evaluate inflammation levels in the body.

results.content: ESR is elevated at 30 mm/hr (normal range: 0-20 mm/hr).

Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR).interpretation: Elevation indicates inflammation, consistent with the presentation of vasculitis.

Urinalysis.purpose: Assess kidney function and check for blood or protein in urine.

results.content: Shows small amounts of blood and protein in the urine.

Urinalysis.interpretation: Findings raise concern for renal involvement in HSP.

Skin Biopsy.purpose: Identify histological features indicative of the underlying cause of rash.

results.content: Biopsy demonstrates IgA deposits in the skin.

Skin Biopsy.interpretation: Supportive of IgA vasculitis, consistent with Henoch-Schönlein Purpura.

Antinuclear Antibody (ANA) Test.purpose: To rule out Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) as differential diagnosis.
Antinuclear Antibody (ANA) Test.interpretation: Negative result decreases concern for SLE.

Allergy Panel Testing.purpose: Determine presence of any allergic reactions.
Allergy Panel Testing.interpretation: To be reviewed once results are available.

Liver Function Tests (LFTs).purpose: Evaluate liver function and detect any liver-related issues.
Liver Function Tests (LFTs).interpretation: To be reviewed once results are available.

Imaging (e.g., X-ray, CT scan).purpose: Assess for other potential causes of abdominal pain.
Imaging (e.g., X-ray, CT scan).interpretation: To be reviewed once results are available.

Electrocardiogram (ECG).interpretation: To be reviewed once results are available.

Blood Culture.purpose: Detect any infections in the bloodstream.
Blood Culture.interpretation: To be reviewed once results are available.
